summary: The Export-Import Bank helps finance U.S. companies' exports when private lenders are unable or unwilling to do so. The Bank is backed by the U.S. government—so taxpayers could be responsible for financial losses. We reviewed the Bank's process to approve financing for exports and found that it appropriately assesses applicants' creditworthiness prior to approval. However, the Bank could improve how it oversees certain lenders authorized...
title: Export-Import Bank: Enhancements Needed in Credit Program Underwriting Policies and Procedures
